text: Okay, we're here. Are you ready?
Absolutely!
Can you repeat your mission?
Of course!
I'm the Axe Knight. I have to defeat the Dragon General with the help of your time loops.
Do you remember how to fight?
Sure!
I can move with [u][A and D][/u] or with [u](Left Stick or D-Pad)[/u].
I can jump with [u][W or Space][/u] or with [u](Left Trigger or Bumper)[/u].
I can attack with [u][Left Click][/u] or with [u](Right Trigger or Bumper)[/u].
And I can aim with [u][Mouse][/u] or with [u](Right Stick)[/u].
Great.
Before we start, some things that I have to mention.
The general has magic. Strong magic.
I'm going to be a ways away, so that he won't be able to kill me during a loop.
Once you get there, you'll only have 40 seconds before the loop loops you back to the start.
Also, if you win or lose, you'll also loop back to the start.
Wait. Hold on.
If I always loop back, then how do I defeat him?
That's where the tough part comes.
You're not actually going to defeat him in a loop.
The loops are for practice against the real deal.
Everything that you see inside the loops, will happen outside of the loops.
So once I'm ready...
Exactly! Once you're ready, I'll end the time loop and you have to fight him for real.
Okay, okay, I think I get it.
I'll practice against the general in the time loops...
Talk to you at the start of each loop...
And then tell you to end the loops once I'm ready!
Perfect!
Okay, start the loops!
Already on it.
